Class GainMeterButton

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container

                      net.sf.fmj.ejmf.toolkit.gui.controls.skins.ejmf.BasicControlButton
                          net.sf.fmj.ejmf.toolkit.gui.controls.skins.ejmf.GainMeterButton
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants, GainMeter
public class GainMeterButton
extends BasicControlButton
implements GainMeter

The gain meter button for StandardControlPanel. This class draws the default gain meter button for StandardControls: A small speaker-shaped icon with "waves" emanating from the front.

A read X is drawn atop the speaker when the gain control is muted. As the gain increase, more "waves" are drawn. As the gain decreases, fewer "waves" are drawn.

GainMeterButton implements GainMeter in order to support these operations.

See Also:
GainMeter, Serialized Form

Method Detail

setLevel

public void setLevel(float level)
Set gain level of gain meter. The input argument is a gain level that gets mapped to a number of "waves" emanating from front of speaker.

Specified by:
setLevel in interface GainMeter
Parameters:
level - is a gain level value that gets mapped to a display value

Set mute state of button

Specified by:
setMute in interface GainMeter
Parameters:

Description copied from interface: GainMeter
Transform a gain control level value [0.0...1.0] to a value appropriate for this GainMeter.

Specified by:
mapToMeterLevel in interface GainMeter
Parameters:
gain - A value returned by getLevel method of a GainControl object.
Returns:
An integer value that represents a legal level value for this GainMeter.
